brainly_data.question:
Which of the following was a colonial advantage in the Revolutionary War?
a. The colonists lacked military experience.
b. All the colonists were united in one cause.
c. The colonists were led by George Washington.
d. All the colonists were Anglicans.
brainly_data.subject: Social studies

all_answers.question:
Which of the following was a colonial advantage in the Revolutionary War?
a. The colonists lacked military experience.
b. All the colonists were united in one cause.
c. The colonists were led by George Washington.
d. All the colonists were Anglicans.
all_answers.subject: Social studies
all_answers.text: I think maybe b because an advantage wouldn't be having lack in military experience. For c George Washington had no experience in war so that wouldn't be an advantage. For d i'm not sure if the colonists were Anglicans in the war and im not sure if that would an advantage. So that's why i think it's b.
